greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If p^b(p,n) is the highest power of the prime p dividing n, then a(n) = product_{p|n} b(p,n)^b(p,n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{fi = Last@Transpose@FactorInteger@n}, Times @@ (fi^fi)]; Rest@Array[f, 93] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Dec 25 2005
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_ and Lambert Herrgesell (zero815(AT)googlemail.com), Dec 27 2005
Corrected the starting offset, data section extended to 105 terms - _Antti Karttunen_, May 28 2017
